question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: BaseState::Remote] [Logging leakage] If Config or BaseState::Remote implements Display or Debug traits, can api_key values be inadvertently logged to validator logs, exposing credentials? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: BaseState::Remote] [Memory disclosure] After Config is dropped, does the api_key String get properly zeroed in memory, or can sensitive key material be recovered from heap dumps or core dumps? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: BaseState::Remote] [Serialization exposure] When Config is serialized with serde_json::to_string_pretty(), is the api_key included in the JSON output, potentially exposing it through error messages or API responses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: BaseState::Remote] [Backup exposure] If config files are included in system backups or snapshots, can attackers with backup access extract api_key values and compromise remote node authentication? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: BaseState::Remote] [API key validation] Does the code validate api_key format or length, or can attackers inject excessively long or malformed keys that cause buffer overflows or DoS in downstream HTTP clients? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: BaseState::Remote] [Version downgrade attack] Can an attacker modify a saved config file to set network_version to an older value, causing the simulation session to use outdated protocol rules and potentially bypass security fixes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: BaseState::Remote] [Version mismatch] Does the code validate that network_version matches the current network protocol version, or can mismatched versions cause state inconsistencies or consensus failures during simulation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: BaseState::Remote] [Future version injection] Can an attacker set network_version to a value higher than the current protocol version, causing undefined behavior or enabling features that haven't been security-audited? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: Config] [Operations counter rollback] Can an attacker modify a saved config to set ops to 0 after many operations have been performed, causing session state to be incorrectly restored and enabling replay of old transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: Config] [Operations counter manipulation] Can an attacker artificially inflate the ops counter in a saved config to skip validation checks or bypass rate limiting that depends on operation counts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Enum: BaseState] [State type confusion] Can an attacker modify a saved config to change BaseState from Remote to Empty or vice versa, causing the simulation session to operate with incorrect base state assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Function: save_to_file()] [JSON injection] Can special characters in node_url or api_key break JSON serialization, allowing an attacker to inject arbitrary JSON fields or create malformed configs that bypass validation on reload? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Function: save_to_file()] [Serialization consistency] If serde_json::to_string_pretty() produces different output for semantically equivalent Config objects due to field ordering, can this cause unnecessary file rewrites or version conflicts? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Function: load_from_file()] [Schema evolution attack] If the Config struct schema changes in future versions, can old saved configs cause deserialization errors or undefined behavior when loaded by newer code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: Config] [Missing integrity check] Does the saved config file include any checksums or signatures to detect tampering, or can an attacker arbitrarily modify saved configs without detection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Function: save_to_file()] [Backup restore attack] If an attacker restores an old config file backup, can they roll back session state to a previous point and replay already-processed transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Enum: BaseState] [Exhaustiveness violation] If new enum variants are added to BaseState in the future, can code that doesn't handle all variants properly cause panics or undefined behavior during deserialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Enum: BaseState] [Discriminant manipulation] Can an attacker craft a binary file (if used instead of JSON) with invalid enum discriminants for BaseState that bypass Rust's type safety and cause memory corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Struct: Config] [Partial initialization] Can Config be constructed in an invalid partial state (e.g., Remote with null node_url) that violates type invariants and causes crashes in consuming code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Function: new()] [Default state security] Does Config::new() create a secure default configuration, or can the default Empty base state be exploited to bypass remote state validation checks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Function: with_remote()] [Missing validation] Does with_remote() validate the node_url, network_version, and api_key parameters before constructing Config, or can invalid values be set that cause errors later? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Function: with_remote()] [Null URL exploitation] Can an attacker pass a Url with empty or null components to with_remote(), creating a Config that crashes when the node_url is later accessed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Function: with_remote()] [Network version bounds] Does with_remote() validate that network_version is within acceptable bounds (not 0 or exceeding u64::MAX), or can extreme values cause integer overflow in version comparison logic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Function: save_to_file()] [Error propagation] Does save_to_file() properly propagate all filesystem errors through Result, or can some error conditions cause panics that crash the simulation process? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/config.rs] [Function: load_from_file()] [Error handling bypass] Can an attacker trigger specific filesystem errors (e.g., EMFILE, ENOMEM) that cause load_from_file() to panic or return corrupted data instead of proper errors? (Medium)
